ALSO READ Sensex, Nifty attain highest closing level in more than a week Prospects of hike in US interest rates pull key indices lower Key indices continue to hover in positive zone India eyes steady steps, not 'big bang', towards freer rupee India eyes steady steps, not "big bang", towards freer rupee Restaurant The Pirates of Grill collaborated with the All India Federation of the Deaf and hosted a lunch on Monday for the physically impaired at their newly opened outlet here. Inderjeet Singh Banga, co-founder of The Pirates of Grill, shared that the collaboration was a small gesture to give back to society. "My restaurant is all about good food for good people. Here, we make sure that our customers are always spoilt for choices with great starters, main course, desserts and more. My idea of hosting this lunch with this federation was to spread happiness with food," Banga said in a statement. "These are special blessed people with pure feelings and enjoy the simpler elements of life, like food. My restaurant is destination for people who want to enjoy simpler things in life, good food served with lots of love and care. This is our small gesture to give back to the society and we will ensure to do a lot more in the future," he added. --IANS
